Package model

Class ImageImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.ImageImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Image
    public class ImageImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Image
    implementation of ImageInterface. - an image representation based on a String[][] of RGB values - an image can be created as a blank white image, or read in from a PPM, JPEG, or PNG file. - the original image created is stored in the builder and can be refreshed (it will go back to its initial state from filters(adjusting the image), but not from adding other images to this image)

        height - the height of the projecy
        width - the width of the project
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any parameters are null or less than 0

    • Method Detail

      • adjustImage

        public void adjustImage​(java.lang.String type,
                        boolean bright,
                        boolean needReset)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Brighten or Darken every pixel in this image. based on the type, max: uses max value of the pixels RGB avg: uses avg value of the pixels RGB luma: uses luma(0.2126R+ 0.7152G +0.0722B) value of the pixels RGB if it is brightening, add the calculated type value to the RGB value of each pixel if it is darkening, subtract the calculated type value from the RGB value of each pixel then make sure the resulting RGB is in bounds of 0-255
        Specified by:
        adjustImage in interface Image
        Parameters:
        type - the type of brightening(max, avg, or luma).
        bright - whether it brightens or darkens
        needReset - if the image needs to be reset beacsue it already has a filter on it

      • changeColor

        public void changeColor​(java.lang.String color,
                        boolean needReset)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        Change the color of every pixel in the image to one of its RGB components. (sets all components not the given color in each pixel to 0) (ex: if "red", all pixels R = its original r-value, G = 0, and B = 0)
        Specified by:
        changeColor in interface Image
        Parameters:
        color - the color that the image should be filtered to
        needReset - if the image needs to be reset to its original state before changing the color

      • rgbToString

        public java.lang.String rgbToString()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        turn the RGB values of this image into a long string of ints. this is in the same format as a PPM(with "P3, width, height, maxVal" at beginning before RGBs)
        Specified by:
        rgbToString in interface Image
        Returns:
        the RGB values of this image as a string

      • rgbToString4Across

        public java.lang.String rgbToString4Across()
        Description copied from interface: Image
        change this image into rgb 4-value string. (the fourth value is the alpha value, which is opaque for PPMs)
        Specified by:
        rgbToString4Across in interface Image
        Returns:
        this image as a string of 4-value rgb values

      • adjustCompositeImage

        public void adjustCompositeImage​(java.lang.String type,
                                 boolean needReset,
                                 Image other)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        adjust image to a filter based on a given Image. essentially, filter this Image based on the given Image's RGB or HSL values (the composite Image of all Images in layers lower than this Image's layer in the project) supports: - difference (inversion blending) - multiply (darkening blending) - screen (brightening blending)
        Specified by:
        adjustCompositeImage in interface Image
        Parameters:
        type - type of filter to add
        needReset - if this Image has a filter on it already and needs to reset before applying another
        other - the composite image to filter with

      • addImage

        public void addImage​(Image img,
                     int x,
                     int y)
        Description copied from interface: Image
        add an image to this image. by using this image and the given images rgb values to overlay the given image over this image, taking into account alpha values(transparency)
        Specified by:
        addImage in interface Image
        Parameters:
        img - the image to be added
        x - the x value of its top left corner
        y - the y value of its top left corner
